units.title: Organoid generation and culture medium preparation
units.text: Colonic epithelial organoid lines were derived as previously described56,57. Brieﬂy, crypts of the healthy portion of the colonic epithelium (at least 10 cm away from the tumor side) were isolated by digestion of the intestinal mucosa in chelation solution (5.6 mM Na2HPO4, 8.0 mM KH2PO4, supplemented with dithiotreitol (0.5 mM, Sigma) and EDTA (2 mM, in-house) for 30 min at 4 °C. Colonic crypts were subsequently plated in basement membrane extract (BME; Cultrex PC BME RGF type 2, Amsbio). Organoids were grown in human intestinal stem cell medium (HISCM), which is composed of Advanced Dulbecco’s modified Eagle medium/F12 supplemented with penicillin/streptomycin, 10 mM HEPES and Glutamax (all Gibco, Thermo Fisher Scientific) with 50% Wnt3a conditioned medium (in-house), 20% R‑Spondin1 conditioned medium (in-house), 10% Noggin conditioned medium (in-house), 1x B27, 1.25mM N‑acetylcysteine, 10 mM nicotinamide, 50 ng/ml human EGF, 10 nM Gastrin, 500 nM A83‑01, 3 µM SB202190, 10 nM prostaglandin E2 and 100 µg/ml Primocin (Invivogen).
units.rationale: Describes how colon organoids are derived, isolated, plated, and cultured.

units.title: Tumor biopsy digestion into single cells
units.text: Tumor biopsies were digested into single cells using collagenase II (1 mg/ml, Gibco, Thermo Fisher Scientific), supplemented with hyaluronidase (10 µg/ml) and LY27632 (10 µM) for 30 min at 37 °C while shaking. Dissociated tumor cells were plated in BME and organoids were cultured in HISCM minus Wnt conditioned medium and supplemented with 10 µM LY27632 at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Provides the enzymatic dissociation protocol for tumor tissue.

units.title: Clonal organoid derivation and FACS sorting
units.text: To generate clonal tumor organoid lines, early passage tumor organoids were dissociated into single cells by TryPLE (Thermo Fisher Scientific), washed and suspended in FACS buffer (PBS with 2 mM EDTA and 5% FCS). Prior to FACS purification, DAPI was added to the FACS buffer. HLA‑A2+ single cells were sorted into separate wells of 96‑well plates containing 100 µl HISCM with 10 µM LY27632 and coated with BME. Sorted cells were then covered with 10 µl BME and placed in the incubator at 37 °C. LY27632 was added to the HISCM for the first week after sorting. Clonal tumor organoids were then expanded in HISCM minus WNT conditioned medium.
units.rationale: Details the single‑cell sorting and initial culture of clonal organoids.

units.title: Organoid harvest and cell recovery
units.text: On the day of harvest, organoids were removed from the 6‑well culture plates using medium and P1000 pipettes and spun down for 8 min at 500 g with the brakes off. Cell pellets were then incubated with Cell Recovery Solution (Roche Diagnostics) for 30 min on ice to remove excess BME. Cells liberated from BME were then washed three times in excess PBS to remove any residual BME. After the last wash, all PBS was removed and the tube opening was quickly dried using a paper towel. Cell pellets were snap frozen in dry ice and stored at −80 °C.
units.rationale: Covers the steps to collect, wash, and store organoid cells for downstream analysis.

units.title: Organoid lysis and protein extraction
units.text: Organoids were lysed by gentle vortexing in 8 M urea in 50 mM ammonium bicarbonate supplemented with 50 µg/ml DNAse I (Sigma‑Aldrich), 50 µg/ml RNAse A (Sigma‑Aldrich) and 1× complete EDTA‑free protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche Diagnostics). Subsequently, the lysate was cleared by centrifugation for 1 h at 18,000 g at 15 °C. Protein concentration was determined with the Bradford assay.
units.rationale: Describes how proteins are solubilized, clarified, and quantified.

units.title: Protein reduction, alkylation and enzymatic digestion
units.text: For each sample, 20 µg of total protein was reduced, alkylated, and digested sequentially with Lys‑C (1:100) and trypsin (1:75).
units.rationale: Specifies the preparation of peptides from extracted proteins.

units.title: High‑pH reversed‑phase peptide fractionation
units.text: Peptide digests were loaded on C18 STAGE‑tips in 200 mM ammonium formate at pH 10 and eluted into 5 fractions with 11–80% acetonitrile.
units.rationale: Outlines the fractionation step to reduce sample complexity before MS.

units.title: Sample drying and reconstitution for LC‑MS/MS
units.text:
All samples were dried by vacuum centrifugation and reconstituted in 10% formic acid prior to LC‑MS/MS analyses.
Per fraction, three technical replicates were measured by LC‑MS/MS.
units.rationale: Prepares peptide fractions for mass‑spectrometry injection.

units.title: DNA isolation and whole‑genome sequencing of organoids
units.text: Organoids were dissociated and DNA was isolated using the QiaSymphony DSP DNA Mini Kit (Qiagen; 937236). Libraries were prepared using the Illumina TruSeq DNA Nano Library Prep Kit (20015964). Paired‑end sequencing of the generated libraries with 30× coverage was performed on the Illumina HiSeq X Ten sequencing system at the Hartwig Medical Foundation.
units.rationale: Provides the workflow for extracting DNA and generating sequencing data.
